definition:
1. To make a hollow, loud noise, as an enraged bull. 2. To bowl; to vociferate; to clamor. Dryden. 3. To roar; as the sea in a tempest, or as the wind when violent; to make a loud, hollow, continued sound. The bellowing voice of boiling seas. Dryden.

To emit with a loud voice; to shout; -- used with out. "Would bellow out a laugh." Dryden.

A loud resounding outcry or noise, as of an enraged bull; a roar.
